alert.note: Alert for Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 29 at 9:36PM CDT until May 29 at 10:15PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: The National Weather Service in North Platte has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Eastern Cherry County in north central Nebraska... * Until 1015 PM CDT/915 PM MDT/. * At 935 PM CDT/835 PM MDT/, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 8 miles northwest of Brownlee to 6 miles southeast of Merritt Reservoir to 18 miles west of Valentine National Wildlife Refuge to 22 miles northwest of Mullen, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Valentine, Valentine National Wildlife Refuge, Merritt Reservoir, Crookston, Highway 97 crossing the North Loup River, Marsh Flat, Schlagel Creek State Wildlife Management Area, Highway 97 crossing the Niobrara River, Highway 97 crossing Big Creek, Sevenmile Hill and Big Alkali Lake State Wildlife Management Area. This includes the following highways... Highway 20 between mile markers 184 and 219. Highway 97 between mile markers 83 and 141. Highway 83 between mile markers 181 and 220. Highway 12 between mile markers 1 and 12. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
